Title: Co-Founder at Zūm Rails
About: Experienced FinTech entrepreneur with a successful track record of building businesses from scratch.  My passion for excellence and achieving results stems from my drive to continuously improve in all aspects of my life. I have had the luxury of working with some very inspiring mentors who have helped shape me into the entrepreneur, leader, and team player I am today.

Current Experience.Description: Zūm's open banking software allows companies to take care of the entire financial interactions; from KYC / onboarding, to instant payments, to the closing of the invoice and everything in between.

Posts.Text:
6 years ago, when I first broke into the FinTech space the first large partnership I ever closed was MX. Not only was this deal instrumental in kick starting my career but the team at MX were absolutely awesome to work with.

Fast forward to today, I am extremely excited to announce that we have come full circle. 

MX and Zūm Rails are partnering to enable open banking capabilities before open banking is even available in Canada. 

Together we will be merging instant payments with open banking technology to create the ultimate end-to-end payment experience.

If you are interested in learning more feel free to reach out and send me a message!

#fintech #payments #openbanking #kyc #digitalonboarding #instantpayments #innovation 

Joe Wallace Nathan Caldwell Andrew Escobar Corinne Bartow

https://lnkd.in/e3xidq2i

Original Post.Text:
Zūm Rails is excited to announce that we have partnered with MX to support their Canadian client’s process instant payments!

MX will use Zūm Rails products to aggregate user information, verify using secure tokens and process multi-rail payments, all done seamlessly through one integration.

Check our website and the full press release to learn more:
https://lnkd.in/gYTFe8Hp

https://zumrails.com

#fintech #paytech #cx #business #payments #paymentprocessing #openbanking #openfinance #tech #innovation #digitaltransformation #datamanagement #finance #bankingindustry #moneymanagement

Posts.Text:
FUN FACT: Did you know Charlie Chaplin entered a Charlie Chaplin look-a-like contest…and lost!

I believe this is a perfect example of how in business just having the best product or being the most qualified isn’t the only factor that goes into success. 

There are so many different ingredients that make up the recipe for success. From timing, to distribution to marketing & sales and everything in between

You can create the best product in the world but if it’s not being distributed, nobody is going to see it and your efforts and energy will have gone to waste

At the end of the day your business and financial success is not an objective you accomplish by being the smartest - it’s a skill that you learn through hands-on experience 

JUST START: Most people waste time trying to be perfect, as oftentimes perfect doesn’t win. 

When we launched Zūm Rails we started selling a very imperfect product. We then listened to the market and made the appropriate improvements and pivots, rather than taking forever to launch the “perfect” product which was instrumental to our success.

#business #success #marketing

August 8th, 2020 Zūm Rails moved its first dollar - 3 years later we are processing over a billion dollars every month.

marc milewski and I's initial goal for building Zūm was to build a software that could solve a small, niche problem in the Canadian market and hopefully make enough money to be sustainable.

Little did we know that this simple idea would blossom into a mighty company that would change the lives of nearly 50 colleagues who are all working towards the same mission and most importantly the life long friendships developed along the way.

When scaling a company, especially in a fully remote environment it is easy to get lost in the day-to-day challenges and be overly focused on results but every August 8th I enjoy taking a step back to appreciate how far we’ve come.

The journey has been filled with hurdles and has been way more challenging than expected. If you aren’t already a resilient person, entrepreneurship will force you to become one.

The Zūm journey has been incredible, and the best is yet to come, I can’t wait to see how much further we will be every August 8th 💥🚀

This month marks the end of my first half decade milestone scaling FinTech startups from scratch.

Prior to entering the FinTech world I had no prior success, no rolodex and no clue what I was doing, to be honest I actually quite lost.

Fortunately I’ve had a lot of “lucky breaks” along the way. I do not believe luck just happens, it's created through being prepared when opportunity presents itself. I guess timing really is everything.

Here are 5 simple ways to increase your luck (at least these have worked for me): 

1) Be irrationally optimistic: Unrealistic thinking breeds unrealistic results and attracts other optimists. 

2) Say yes to every meeting: Your next lucky break / chance encounter might be one conversation away.

3) Your habits when you’re not working are equally as important as the hours spent working: develop a healthy routine outside of work and unplug.

4) Never be the smartest person in the room: It’s interesting how I get "luckier" the more brilliant and like-minded people I meet and interact with

5) Be curious: Curious people never stop growing and always seek to improve.

Bonus tip: Have fun: The more you enjoy the journey the more your positivity attracts the right people 

 #fintech #opportunity

Today marks a huge milestone for Zūm as we’ve been recognized as one of the top 10 growth companies in Canada by CIX.

Zūm began as a groundbreaking idea, but it was just that, an idea. It wasn’t until we hired an amazing team to build on that initial idea that Zūm became great. 

When scaling a company, especially in a fully remote environment it is easy to get lost in the day to day challenges and be overly focused on results. I realized early on how important it is to never lose sight of the human element as that is the most special part of the journey.

It’s been a fun and unique process to self-fund Zūm to nearly 50 team members all throughout a pandemic.

Most of the team has never met face-to-face but the drive to accomplish so much with a minimal amount of capital has been inspiring. We are all motivated by the same mission of merging instant payments and open banking to streamline the entire payment journey.

At Zūm we understand that everything is better when money moves faster but historically faster money movement meant faster fraud losses. We are tackling this issue by utilizing aggregation data and instantaneous KYC tools to support fast, but secure, transfers.

Although this is just the beginning of Zūm’s story, I am extremely grateful for the early success we’re experiencing but even more excited to see what the future has in store for Zūm!

https://lnkd.in/ejK6wF9P

#fintech # #banking #canada #openbanking #grateful

Posts.Text:
The more time you spend in payments the more you realize that moving funds is easy, but everything around the payment and edge cases are hard.

Historically, the faster money moves, the higher the probability of fraud and chargebacks

Moving money is less than 20% of the payment process, which is why Zūm has reimagined what a payment looks like. 

We’ve done this through building proprietary risk tools, name matching tools, data aggregation with insights, reporting and tying all key data points to allow funds to move in real-time while significantly reducing fraud and chargebacks

Check out this video below which highlights how Zūm’s platform has created the future of open banking and payments!

#payments #kyc #fraudprevention #fintech #data

Entrepreneurship is glamorized, although in reality it’s anything but glamorous. When scaling a startup there are daily fires to burn out, there is constant uncertainty and even when things are going well there’s always paranoia that the success isn’t happening quickly enough.

Although entrepreneurship feels like sprinting a marathon, it is important to take a step back at times to reflect.

Last month when Zūm held its offsite activities throughout Canada and Brazil, each team shared pictures from their off-sites. 

When I saw these pictures it was the first time it dawned on me that Zūm is no longer the concept Marc and I were mapping out at my parent’s kitchen table a few years ago but is now a very legitimate company making a real impact on people all over the world which meant way more to me than I realized.

Below is the picture of the Zūm team from Brazil during their off site, hopefully on their next offsite I’ll be joining them in Brazil 🇧🇷 

It’s amazes and means the world to me that my entrepreneurial journey in Canada has positively impacted people on the other side of the world and will continue to impact more and more people.

I realize how fortunate I am to be in this position and this change in perspective has made me realize success goes beyond just hitting revenue milestones.

It’s funny how just a different way of framing something can have such a significant impact on how we view things. 

Lesson: Change of perspective will elevate your mood and clear your mind: A clear mind, leads to better judgement, leads to better outcome and to the formation of new insights.

Marcel Ferreira Marc Milewski Samoel Nunes Pereira Daniel Souza Renan Zacheo Felipe Lupepic Nathan Ruiz Guilherme Shiba Goto Guilherme Rodrigues Bilar

Today I am proud to announce that Zūm Rails processes over $1 BILLION DOLLARS every month!

Back when marc milewski and I founded Zūm Rails, I asked Marc would you ever move to Montreal?
 
Marc’s response: I will make you a deal, if we process over 1 billion dollars in monthly transactions, I’ll move to Montreal.

3 years later it’s moving day 😎 

Although it’s just the beginning of the journey, I'm proud of what Zūm  has become and can’t wait to see what the future has in store 🚀 

#fintech #milestone #payments #openbanking #growth #selffunded

Check out this clip from Sue Britton & Surinderjit Kaur Bhatti's Disrupticons Podcast where I disucss the importance of speed to market. 

It's important to get to market as quickly as possible, take feedback and make the appropriate pivots, rather than taking forever to launch the “perfect” product.

This strategy was critical for Zūm's success as our early stage clients helped us build a best in class product.

#fintech #entrepreneur #podcast #startup

Task failed successfully...

After 2 + years we have rapidly expanded to nearly 40 team members without needing to raise any money. In addition to payments Zūm Rails has launched a suite of unmatched Risk/KYC products that streamline the entire financial interaction. 

Our team is on track to double in size by the end of the year and we are well prepared for not just the U.S but global expansion. 

Despite this trajectory, when trying to get speaking engagements or getting invited on podcasts, the first question we are often asked is how much capital have we raised and since we are self-funded we are frequently dismissed, despite our company’s valuation being in the 9 figures.

We live in a business culture where we celebrate companies who are well funded, as if raising money was the desired outcome of the business, as opposed to also celebrating profitable companies who have achieved product market fit and do not require external funding to scale.

Whether we decide to raise money or not should not be a deciding factor whether we are considered a “somebody” in the FinTech space.

Reach out to me if you want to talk about how Zūm is continuing to build software that is accelerating open banking. It would be awesome to connect with like minded people.

#fintech #kyc #openbanking #payments

Task failed successfully…..again!

Last week I posted about how business culture only celebrates companies who are well funded as opposed to also celebrating profitable companies who achieved product market fit and do not require external funding to scale. 

Ironically that post alone in a single morning improved Zūm’s optics: 50,000 people viewed the post, I received more invites to speak at  legitimate events and got invited onto more podcasts than I have in my entire life.

Prior to this Zūm has spent the last 2+ years successfully scaling the company to a 9 figure valuation in silence, despite Zūm’s financial success we received very few invites to speak at events. But a Linkedin post that took 15 minutes to write made me all of the sudden a “thought leader”

Moral of the story:

We live in a culture where success alone isn’t enough, optics matter!  

At the end of the day people want to do business with people / brands that they recognize, identify with and trust. 

Which is why it is critical to put yourself out there and create engaging content that is authentically you. This will allow you to stand out since most people are too shy to put themselves out there. 

#fintech #business #content #marketing #openbanking #payments

I am really excited to announce that Zūm has  hired James Tice as VP of Sales. We have been very patient when filling this role as we understand the positive impact the right person would have on changing the course of the business.

James and I clicked right away and it was clear that James has a gift you can’t teach when it comes to sales. James possesses magnetic personality and is able to easily build relationships.

At the end of the day it’s simple, people want to do business with people they like, which why hiring James was a no brainer. 

Sales is all about being comfortable in uncomfortable situations and James is proof of that as James asked some very direct and bold questions that most people would not have ever asked during the interview process, which really resonated with me.

I am extremely pumped to go through this next phase of growth with you 🚀🚀

Feel free to dm James to if you’d like to learn more about Zūm, and make sure to add James Tice on Linkedin as he will be sharing his journey with Zūm.

#newhire #sales #payments #openbanking #fintech

🚨Breaking News 🚨

Zūm Rails prevented the Grinch from ruining Christmas :)

Check out this festive video to see how Zūm Rails prevented the Grinch from stealing Santa’s identity through our name matching tool.

Luckily for Santa (and everyone else) Zūm is eliminating fraud and chargebacks through our name matching and additional proprietary risk tools, all powered by our data aggregation, with real-time insights to ensure you really know your customers.

Reach out to me to learn more about how Zūm Rails moves billions of dollars per year while virtually eliminating fraud and chargebacks

Happy holidays everyone 🎅 🎄 🤶 

#kyc #payments #fintech #fraud #openbanking #tech

I feel hypocritical...

I’ve only shared on Linkedin the milestones and the successes - although the journey of launching Zūm Rails was anything but smooth. 

If I had one regret it would be not taking pictures / videos of documenting the Zūm journey from the beginning, although when dealing with obstacle after obstacle trying to get off the ground, the last thing on my mind was documenting the journey in case it turns out to be a success story.

Although Marc and I understood that there was a huge opportunity in creating faster payments mixed with open banking software, we were unable to attract an investor to believe in our mission as our idea seemed too complicated and impossible.

Every company needs their lucky break, ours happened in May 2020 when Marcel who I had known from my past, reached out to me enquire about Zūm and decided to join as our CTO. Marcel Ferreira joining was the turning point of getting Zūm to where it is today.

Within 4 months of Marcel joining we were able to hit 7 figures ARR and the upwards trajectory never stopped 🚀

Please take a few minutes to check out the video below that highlights the Zūm journey.

#fintech #openbanking #payments #founders

A question I often get asked is why Zūm Rails decided to never raise money. The truth is this was never the plan. 

2.5 years ago when launching Zūm, Marc and I tried pitching investors on our mission to reimagine what a payment looks like by merging real-time payments with real-time fraud detection in a single software.

All investors did was tell us all the reasons why this would not succeed:

- This was too large and complicated of a problem to tackle
- We were both first time entrepreneurs 
- The barrier to entry in payments is too large

The list went on and on of why we couldn’t do this, but fortunately this didn’t discourage Marc and I, if anything made us more motivated.

Since then we’ve had great initial traction and have been able to be scale profitably to over 40 employees, have processed over $5 Billion dollars, and are on track to double our revenues over the next quarter.

Although there were many lucky breaks along the way, looking back I realize that a lot of Zūm’s luck wasn’t really luck at all, we had a blueprint for success and stuck to it:

- We found a problem that was huge and painful
- We understood the problem more deeply than anyone else
- We remained irrationally optimistic despite early setbacks 
- We assembled a team that’s uniquely qualified to solve that problem
- We constantly speak with our customers for feedback and continuously evolve

Despite our initial traction, I’ve noticed how much harder it was to get validation from the market by being self funded.

We live in a business culture where we celebrate companies who are well funded, as if raising money was the desired outcome of the business, as opposed to also celebrating profitable companies who have achieved product market fit and do not require external funding to scale. 

Here’s to hoping profitable companies are soon to be the cool kids on the block again  😎 

#fintech #payments #openbanking #funding

Check out this clip of me on the PNR Podcast when Nectarios Economakis asked me about my mindset when starting Zūm Rails and how my mindset has shifted as Zūm has scaled

#podcast #mindset #enterpreneur

Today marks the 2 year anniversary of the launch of Zūm Rails (yes we launched a FinTech company less than one week before a pandemic), this was also the last time I saw my co-founder Marc Milewski face-to-face.

This anniversary got me reminiscing to 2 years ago when the Zūm headquarter was my parent’s kitchen table and the only meetings we had were attempts to pitch investors on how we were planning on changing the way money was moved … we got laughed out of the room.

At the time we understood the B2B payment landscape in Canada created a lot of friction and inefficiencies which is why we built our payment software which not only allows money to move instantly, but also build the tools / software around the payment to ensure businesses’ really know their customers as well as virtually eliminate fraud.

Fast forward 2 years, with just our initial product, without any venture capital, Zūm has scaled to over 30 employees and processes billions of dollars monthly.

In the coming months we will be announcing the launch of new products that will further our vision and enable us to take Zūm to the next level and be the first company to create the ultimate open banking software

I can’t wait to begin sharing what we’ve been cooking up and looking forward to continuing delivering on our mission of streamlining financial interactions.

Dm me if you’re interested in learning more or looking to join the team, Zūm is hiring 😎

#fintech #payments #openbanking

Reunited at last! It had been 25 months since I’ve been face-to-face with my Co-Founder @Marc Milewski. I do not enjoy using the word Co-Founder to describe Marc, as I consider Marc to be my brother.

It’s crazy to think how far we’ve come since the last time we’ve seen each other. The last time we were together we were sitting at our “office” aka my parent’s kitchen table coming up with a business plan for Zūm Rails. 

Fast forward 25 months, Zūm has scaled to over 30 employees and processes billions of dollars monthly.

When scaling a company, especially in a fully remote environment it is easy to get lost in the day to day challenges and be overly focused on results. 

For the first time in as long as I can remember seeing Marc today made me reflect and appreciate how far we’ve truly come.

Although Zūm is just getting started, I realize how important it is to never lose sight of the human element as that is the most special part of the journey.

Can’t wait for the next phase of scaling Zūm and seeing the Zūm team continue to grow. 

Zūm is always hiring, if you are interested in joining the team or learning more about Zūm’s payment / open banking software dm me.

#fintech #payments #openbanking #startup

Today I am proud to announce that Zūm Rails has launched its U.S headquarters in Miami 🚀

The last time Zūm Rails had a physical office, it was my parent’s kitchen table where Marc Milewski and I were trying to get Zūm off the ground 3 years ago.

When reflecting on the Zūm journey it hit me that Zūm has no business being what it is today.

Our initial goal for building Zūm was to build a software that could solve a small, niche problem in the Canadian market and hopefully make enough money to be sustainable.

But once we started solving this problem, our clients would express other problems they wanted us to solve and would keep paying us to keep building software that can solve problems.

Momentum is a powerful thing, never in our wildest dreams, did we imagine that a single idea for a single market could have expanded into 8 different products, over 40 team members, tens of billions of dollars moved, a U.S division, all while being profitable and entirely self-funded.

Most people have the idea of needing to do something big. As the famous saying goes “shoot for the moon, even if you miss, you’ll land among the stars.” 

However, in my opinion, it can be easier to set yourself up for success starting small to solve a specific problem, as you never know what that can evolve into.

#fintech #usa #payments #openbanking

It’s wild how we’ve been able to achieve such massive scale with a single product, in a single country. I am pumped to announce that Zūm Rails has just launched its latest product: Invoice & Subscription 📈
 
Our platform will allow your business to streamline recurring / subscription billing, as well as present electronic invoices to ensure your business can get paid 24/7 using multiple INSTANT payment methods. Never miss a payment while ensuring the best user experience.

In the next few months we have several new products that will further streamline the financial interaction, as well as expanding to the U.S. Stay tuned for more updates 🚀 

To learn more, please reach out to me directly!

#fintech #payments #invoices #subscriptions #instantpayments

Growing up I was always jealous of people who knew exactly what they wanted to be in life whether it be a lawyer, doctor, teacher because they would become it and had a clear path.

As I’ve gotten older, I realized not knowing what I wanted to do when I was younger and throughout my early career has allowed me to reinvent myself everyday. 

Although not knowing is the more difficult path it has it has allowed me to evolve and lead me to my entrepreneurial journey. 

Launching and scaling a company accelerates the pace at which you need to adapt and puts you on an emotional roller coaster unlike anything you’ve ever experienced.

You will flip rapidly from a day where you think you are going to take over the world, to a day which doom feels like only weeks away.

When starting Zūm the financial upside excited me. While being on this journey I realize the real value is the person you become and the people you impact, not the recognition or the reward.

#entrepreneur #fintech

Usually in business making major decisions is really difficult. When we posted a few months ago we were looking for a Chief Operating Officer we received many qualified applications. We believed this was going to be one of those extremely tough decisions. 

That was until Tara Wilson came along and made this decision very easy (shoutout to Chelsea Finnemore for connecting us).  

Within minutes of speaking to Tara, it was obvious that Tara possesses an energy and aura that is magnetic. This combined with her impressive resume and leadership ability makes the future of Zūm even more exciting.

I am extremely pumped to announce that Tara Wilson has joined Zúm Rails as our COO :)

Tara has spent the last 5 years as the COO of Income Access (a Paysafe company). This going to be a fun ride, can’t wait to go through this adventure together!

Also I gotta admit The Zūm merch looks pretty awesome 😎

Unfortunately my time at Binance.US came to an end yesterday as the company continues to right size and navigate through this crypto winter that has been made significantly worse by a confusing and challenging regulatory environment.

Disappointment aside, my time at at Binance.US has been nothing short of amazing. I was part of the Fiat Team and worked on a number of interesting projects during my stint there. More importantly, I had the good fortune to meet some of the smartest and hard-working folks in the crypto space whom I will miss working closely with very much. Thank you Gerry Ho and Tom H for taking a chance on me.  

My professional journey in the crypto space has been quite the roller coaster ride thus far; but I have learnt so much from both my time at both Newton Crypto and Binance.US. I am looking for a new product role in the crypto space  and would appreciate any connections, advice, or opportunities. Please send me a message or leave a comment below to connect. I am also more than happy to share my experiences with anyone looking to get into the crypto space :) #OpenToWork

Reactions.Contact Role: Building the voice for Cannabis accessibility and lifestyle through media, tech, events, education and sales enablement

Post Details.Text:
I remember being 24 and seeing a respected manager get fired. 

This manager had helped me significantly in navigating the first two years of my sales development journey into account executive.

I thought "how could a manager like that be fired?"

My current leader at the time told me that at a certain point, you aren't surprised any more and that everyone is Replaceable.

Over the next few years I internalized that info. Saw it first hand in the swinging door of talent and turnover in Cannabis.

Now I no longer believe that. I believe that some people are absolutely not replaceable. The speed of learning, the grit, the self awareness, compete level, and ability to get shit done is hard as hell to find.

When KIND was in a pinch and needed a specialist with surgical like precision in May, we got lucky and hired Reuben Molot-Toker on a 3 mo contract.

If it was anyone else, I'm not sure we would have been successful in our endeavor. 

But because we hired the A+ player, plug and play, that I had worked with before, could count on, and knew could take on the task at hand with autonomy and hustle....well that's irreplaceable.

Talent is numero uno. People are no longer replaceable. Lock in your best, otherwise you won't even make the playoffs, let alone compete for the championship.

#talent #turnover #orgbehavior

Reactions.Contact Role: Co-Founder & CEO at Chexy | Ex-Square, Ex-Deloitte

Post Details.Text:
Today is a pretty important milestone for Chexy. After over a year of hard work and *literal* tears - we are excited to announce that we have partnered with Equifax to allow renters across Canada to build credit on their rent payments. 

This hits close to home as it solves a personal pain point I had after coming to Canada as an international student. After about 12 months in the country, I got one of those Capital One flyers about being approved for my first ever credit card - and guess what, it was for a whooping $4000 limit. Being 19 and knowing nothing about credit scores made me think - "Hell YES, free money", racking up that amount in cc debt in a matter of two months...

Also being 19, I had no way of paying this off and I would rather die and tell my eastern European parents that I needed a "bail out". It took me 3 years of paying it off and seeing my credit score get to ~500. 

But guess what? I always paid my rent on time. And that never counted to help with credit...I remember thinking back then the system is completely rigged 😅 

This is true for most Canadians - you pay rent on time every month, repaying thousands in contract obligations (just like with your phone bill) but it never helps. Also most people would always pay rent on time even if they can't afford to pay their cc in full as shelter comes first and foremost. 

Not to mention, for 1.5M newcomers coming to Canada by 2025...building credit is becoming harder. Banks are not easily giving out credit cards as it was back in the day, not in this market environment. So qualifying for car loans, mortgages and even an apartment is a real challenge.  

Which is why it's about time you got the credit you deserve for paying rent. Use Chexy and earn rewards while at it 😜 

I am extremely excited we get to roll out features that make a true impact to million of Canadians and we are not stopping by anytime soon! (psst future landlord features 👀 ) 

If you are thinking "hell yes", head over to sign up link before and let's see your credit soar!

There’s no single career path that leads to becoming an entrepreneur. All of the entrepreneurs I know have had multiple roles and experiences along the way. 

Mine has certainly been unpredictable and varied. So many things that I didn’t plan for or realize would have value later ended up being useful along the journey in ways I never could have predicted.

A few of my twists and turns:

- I was kicked out of university the first time around. It forced me to re-evaluate what I wanted to do in life (and orient towards business). It also snapped me back to reality because I realized that to accomplish anything, you need focus and hard work. 

- While trying to pay my tuition and pay back student loans, I accidentally became a creator, video maker, YouTuber, and teacher through creating my online course teaching the LSAT. Years later, I looked back and realized that this was a turning point for my love of teaching, creating and strengthened my desire to make an impact on someone else’s life. It was an important moment on my entrepreneurship journey.

- I went through a phase of saying yes to almost any opportunity I came across — whether it was acting, travelling, or public speaking which terrified me and so many more unexpected experiences. Through this, I learned when to say no, when I needed to focus and also picked up a tonne of new skills that I put to use later. 

Fellow entrepreneurs and creators, I’d love to hear about the defining moments that led to where you are now. 

#ThePath #TopVoices #CreatorEconomy #Thinkific #CreatorEducator

Post Details.Text:
🎉 Celebrating Love, Support and Work Life Balance 🥂

Today, I want to take a break from the usual work updates and connect with you on a more personal note. In the whirlwind of professional life, it's important to pause and cherish the relationships that ground us. 🌟

As I celebrate my wedding anniversary today, I wanted to pause and introduce you to my rock, my confidant, and my partner-in-everything, Keith. While he might not be active on LinkedIn, I know so many of my industry friends and connections are, and I'm thrilled to share a glimpse of our journey with you all.

Keith and I first crossed paths in 2009, igniting an incredible journey together. In 2014, we exchanged vows, promising enduring support through all of life's twists and turns. Then in 2020, amidst the global upheaval, we decided to swoon over each other once again, and renew those vows to each other. (I mean, he looks so cute in a suit... how could I resist). 

He's not just my husband, he's my biggest cheerleader, my sounding board for crazy ideas, and my constant source of encouragement. From patiently listening to my daily work adventures to celebrating every life milestone, he's been by my side, unwavering in his support. 

💼 In the ever-evolving landscape of work, finding equilibrium between professional and personal realms is a constant endeavor for me. Keith excels at this art, showing me the profound importance of this balance. He's taught me that my achievements in the workplace are enriched by the love and strength we cultivate at home.

As we all gear up for Lend360, I'm excited to share that Mr. Wilson will be joining me this year, sharing his infectious positivity and good vibes. Feel free to say hi and exchange a warm smile if you spot us! 👋🏼

In a world that's constantly moving, let's not forget the connections that truly matter. Here's to love, partnership, and celebrating the extraordinary people who shape our lives. 🤍

Thank you for being a part of my journey, both professionally and personally. Here's to many more years of growth, friendship, and shared moments! 💛

🚀 Excited to share my experience at the Blockchain Futurist Conference 2023! 🌐

Just wrapped up an incredible few days at the forefront of innovation and disruption in the world of blockchain and cryptocurrency. The Blockchain Futurist Conference brought together some of the brightest minds, industry experts, and visionaries to discuss the latest trends, technologies, and insights shaping our digital future.

It was a wonderful experience working with my VirgoCX colleagues to share VirgoCX services with the audience and get inspired to bring new innovations to the platform. 

From thought-provoking keynote sessions to engaging panel discussions, the conference delved into a wide range of topics including decentralized finance (DeFi), non-fungible tokens (NFTs), blockchain scalability, sustainability, and the transformative potential of Web3. The networking opportunities were unparalleled, providing a platform to connect with like-minded professionals, investors, and enthusiasts who share a passion for blockchain's potential to revolutionize industries.

A personal highlight was hearing from pioneers who are driving real-world adoption of blockchain technology across sectors such as finance, supply chain, healthcare, and more. The energy and enthusiasm were infectious, and I'm returning home with a renewed sense of purpose and inspiration.

A big thank you to the organizers for orchestrating such a successful and impactful event. As we navigate this rapidly evolving landscape, I'm excited to leverage the insights gained to contribute to the ongoing advancement of blockchain technology and its applications.

#BlockchainFuturist2023 #blockchainconference  #innovation  #cryptorevolution  #networkingopportunity #virgocx #virgo  #blockchain 

Feel free to reach out to me if you'd like to discuss the conference highlights or explore potential collaborations. Looking forward to continuing the conversation and shaping the future together! 🌟

About.Owerview:
Zūm Rails’ software solves the payment puzzle. Zūm sees payments as more than just moving funds faster and smarter, but rather improving the entire financial interaction between a business and its end users. Our software streamlines the onboarding process, provides advanced KYC / AML tools, moves funds in real-time, manages payment operations and simplifies reconciliation, all through a single API layer or payment portal that offers the most elegant user experience in the market. 

Our Mission:

Sending and receiving payments is the life-blood of any fast-growing business. But payment processing is full of friction and pain points that can impede the growth of your business. Zūm is designed from the ground up to make managing payments better, faster, and less expensive. Anyone can provide a payment service. No one can manage payments as efficiently as Zum.

Our Vision:

Zūm delivers payment management solutions that eliminate friction, optimize efficiency, and give you a competitive advantage in the market place.

Our Products:

Available payment services include:

Visa Direct: Send and receive money from almost any Visa card in real-time. Also, Zūm has layered additional security features to provide the most advanced Visa Direct payment solution in the market.

Interac: Push and pull funds at scale, to and from a bank account, in real-time with higher funding limits.

EFT: Facilitate seamless payments by connecting to North America's banking network.

Credit Card: Access cost-effective credit card processing to ensure no payment is missed.

You can also access a powerful set of payment tools to automate onboarding, enhance KYC/ AML and simplify reconciliation.

Posts.Text:
🎉 Exciting News! The Evstry Gifting Platform is Live! 🚀

Today, we are thrilled to announce the launch of Evstry's Gifting Platform, the "future of digital gifts" 🎁✨

This platform combines the personalized touch of a greeting card, like those from Hallmark, with seamless and secure money transfer capabilities you may have experienced with Interac or PayPal.

Sending cash gifts has never been easier - you can now send up to $3,000 for just $2.99! 💰😲

We owe this achievement to the valuable feedback we received from the 500+ users who gifted over $25,000 across 25 events nationwide since our initial launch.

Using this momentum, we partnered with Zūm Rails, the open banking software platform that powers Evstry to launch the Gifting Platform. Miles Schwartz and his team have been instrumental in supporting Evstry in our journey to change how Canadians send and receive cash gifts. 

We would also like to thank all of our supporters and backers including the Schulich School of Business - York University (Chris Carder, Cherry Rose Tan, MBA, MA, Ashwin Joshi, Mudit Rawat, Tanika McLeod), YSpace, York University (David Kwok, Nafis Ahmed), MindFrame Connect (Brice Scheschuk, CPA, CA), Treefrog Accelerator, Parkdale Centre for Innovation, Wildeboer Dellelce LLP, Collision Conf and the countless other mentors, friends and family who have supported Evstry.

We are incredibly grateful for your support and thank you for being part of our journey! 🚀🎊

So what are you waiting for? Head over to www.evstry.com to experience the future of digital cash gifting today!

Cc Kavita S.

#Evstry #GiftingPlatform #DigitalGifts #CashRegistry #Gratitude #Technology #Entrepreneurship #Innovation

Today I am proud to announce that Zūm Rails has launched its U.S headquarters in Miami 🚀

The last time Zūm Rails had a physical office, it was my parent’s kitchen table where Marc Milewski and I were trying to get Zūm off the ground 3 years ago.

When reflecting on the Zūm journey it hit me that Zūm has no business being what it is today.

Our initial goal for building Zūm was to build a software that could solve a small, niche problem in the Canadian market and hopefully make enough money to be sustainable.

But once we started solving this problem, our clients would express other problems they wanted us to solve and would keep paying us to keep building software that can solve problems.

Momentum is a powerful thing, never in our wildest dreams, did we imagine that a single idea for a single market could have expanded into 8 different products, over 40 team members, tens of billions of dollars moved, a U.S division, all while being profitable and entirely self-funded.

Most people have the idea of needing to do something big. As the famous saying goes “shoot for the moon, even if you miss, you’ll land among the stars.” 

However, in my opinion, it can be easier to set yourself up for success starting small to solve a specific problem, as you never know what that can evolve into.
